situation.title: Interpretation of the antigen test result, how to behave after receiving the Ag test result
situation.meta_description: If the patient is asymptomatic and the result of the Ag tests is positive, the subject who performed the test indicates a confirmatory PCR test right on the spot.

content.processed:
The antigen test came out negative, but you have symptoms

You are probably suffering from another illness and you should contact your GP to make an appointment.

The antigen test came out positive, but you have no symptoms

If the patient is asymptomatic and the result of the Ag tests is positive, the subject who performed the test indicates a confirmatory PCR test right on the spot. It is therefore not necessary to undergo it again. Only serious operating reasons of the test equipment may make it impossible to perform the PCR test immediately. In this case, you will be ordered for a PCR test and instructed on how to behave by then. Be in isolation until the PCR test result is sent. If you are positive, tell your GP.

The antigen test was positive

If you also have symptoms, you will be sent to isolation and, if necessary, you will be provided with medical care. Respectively, the procedure will be the same as if you were indicated by a positive PCR test, which was normally tested until the onset of antigens. Your contacts will also be routed by default.

The exact instructions will always be communicated to you individually together with the test result.

questions_answers.question: Jsem praktický lékař a přišel ke mě pacient se symptomy onemocnění COVID-19. Jak ho mám nechat otestovat?
questions_answers.value:
Pokud máte k dispozici vybavení a možnosti pro provedení antigenního testu, splňujícího minimální požadavky na kvalitu, můžete test od 4. 12. provést pedagogickému pracovníkovi, od 18. 12. pak jakémukoli svému pacientovi. 

Pokud vyjde antigenní test pozitivní, je pacient považován za infikovaného.

Pokud je výsledek negativní, pošlete pacienta na kontrolní PCR test a řiďte se jeho výsledkem. Pokud by PCR test vyšel negativní, ale pacientovi by potíže přetrvávaly/zhoršovaly se po 5 dní, zvažte zopakování antigenního či PCR testu.
